content.question: A box of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> slides along a horizontal surface. The forces exerted on the box are indicated in the figure. There is negligible friction between the box and the horizontal surface. Which of the following expressions is equal to the magnitude of the acceleration of the box?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub T, end sub, times open parenthesis, 1 plus the cosine of theta, close parenthesis, and denominator M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>T</mi></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>M</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub T, end sub, times open parenthesis, 1 minus the cosine of theta, close parenthesis, and denominator M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>T</mi></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>M</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator F sub T, end sub, times open parenthesis, 1 minus the cosine of theta, close parenthesis, plus F sub N, end sub, minus M g, and denominator M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>T</mi></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>M</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>
